parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering cylinder can cause a loss of power steering, leading to increased effort required to steer the vehicle, which can increase the risk of accidents, especially at low speeds. In extreme cases, it can also lead to a fire under the hood.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Steering Component Failure (Tie Rod/Broke Steering Wheel Rod)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of steering components, such as the tie rod or steering wheel rod, can cause a loss of control of the vehicle, leading to accidents and injuries.
symptoms: Tie rod failed and dropped downward
steering wheel rod broke while changing lanes
severe injury to driver's right hand.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive wind noise and malfunctioning sunroof/windows can cause driver distraction, leading to accidents.
Fuel pump failure can cause the engine to stall, leading to accidents, especially when driving at high speeds.
The deterioration of the headlamp lens can lead to a reduction in light transmission, compromising the driver's visibility and safety on the road, especially at night or in low-light conditions.
symptoms: Headlamp lens turns foggy or translucent
inability to transmit light to U.S. DOT standards.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical System Failure (Light Bulbs and Horns)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The frequent burning out of light bulbs and horns can cause a safety hazard, especially at night or in low-visibility conditions, and can lead to accidents or near-misses.
symptoms: Frequent burning out of light bulbs (tail lights

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the turn signal switch can lead to a loss of signaling functionality, increasing the risk of accidents or near-misses, especially when changing lanes or turning.
symptoms: poor operation of the switch when wheels are not pointed straight ahead.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine oil leaks can lead to engine damage, overheating, and potentially cause the engine to seize, resulting in loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: oil spots or puddles under the vehicle

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Belt tensioner failure can cause the serpentine belt to break, leading to loss of power steering, alternator failure, and engine overheating, which can result in loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Squealing or grinding noise from the engine

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Oxygen sensor failure can cause the engine to run rich or lean, leading to decreased fuel efficiency, increased emissions, and potentially causing the engine to stall or fail, resulting in loss of control and increased risk of accidents.
